newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toyota Motor to repurchase shares - paper.
newsitem.headline: Toyota Motor to repurchase shares - paper.

text.p: Toyota Motor Corp has decided to repurchase some of its shares in fiscal 1997/98 and will formally announce the plans later on Thursday, the Thursday evening edition of a Japanese financial newspaper said.
According to the Nihon Keizai Shimbun, the buy-back will be carried out in July or later, after it is approved at a shareholders meeting scheduled for late June.
The cost of the share repurchase, the company's second, is likely to be similar to or larger than the first repurchase, in which up to 100 billion yen worth of shares was bought, the paper said.

Toyota bought back its shares for the first time between July 1996 and March 1997. It had originally planned to buy back 43 million shares, which was 1.2 percent of the outstanding shares. But as the share price rose, only 33.53 million shares were bought, the paper said.
Toyota officials declined to comment on the share repurchase report.
